info.title: NetFoundry Public REST API
info.description:
NetFoundry’s web console and API are used to define networks by designing and instantly deploying AppWANs which are policies that describe how endpoints are permitted to access services. 

Most operations require an expiring auth token as described in [the authentication guide](https://developer.netfoundry.io/v1/guides/authentication/).

You may find more helpful guides, references, and tools to use with this API in the [NetFoundry Developer Portal](https://developer.netfoundry.io/).

get.summary: Monitor the progress of an AppWAN modification.
get.description: Monitor the progress of a prior UPDATE to an AppWan. It returns an array of processing steps that an AppWan will go through when being created or updated.  The returned steps contain a current status (in progress, completed, etc.), reflecting the current state of that process-step.

post.description: Initialize an empty AppWAN for authorizations that will be added later.

get.summary: List of all endpoints for network.
get.description:
Pagination params:
 * page: page number
 * size: number of list elements per page
 * sort: comma-separated list of sort field (an attribute of the endpoints) and direction ("ASC" or "DESC")
Produces a top-level map `.page` in the response like
```
"page": {
    "number": 1,
    "size": 1,
    "totalElements": 1,
    "totalPages": 1
}
```

parameters.name: networkId
parameters.description: the ID of the network to get paginated endpoints from

post.summary: Create a node(s) on the edge of your network.
post.description:
An endpoint is node on the edge of your network. Protected network traffic flows to, from, and through endpoints. Clients and gateways are initiating endpoints from which traffic flows toward services. Services are terminated by an endpoint to which traffic flows from clients and gateways. An endpoint in an AppWAN may represent an app, a device, or some IP addresses. For example,
 * An app that is built with a Ziti Endpoint SDK is an embedded endpoint, and
 * a device where Tunneler is running is a client endpoint, and
 * a router where Tunneler is running is a gateway endpoint forwarding for some IP addresses.

See the schema here for possible values for the fields. The most commonly-used fields are name, endpointType, geoRegionId.

 It is also possible to upload a CSV file to this endpoint. Headings are:
 * NAME: a required, meaningful string that is unique within this network
 * ENDPOINTTYPE: required all-caps string without whitespace e.g. "VCPEGW". All possible values described in the schema for create-endpoint
 * GEOREGION: optional but preferred location field. The display name of the geographic region i.e. attribute *name* from /rest/v1/geoRegions.
 * DATACENTER: This optional and alterative to the preferred location field: GEOREGION. The display name of the specific datacenter in a georegion i.e. attribute *locationName* from /rest/v1/dataCenters.
 * PROVIDER: optional value specifying dataCenter cloud provider from /rest/v1/dataCenters attribute *provider*.
